name: ListServices
description:
Fetch a list of existing Pagerduty services.

Use this tool to retrieve a list of services, which may represent applications, components, or teams for incident management.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: Specifies the API version using the Accept header for versioning purposes.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Sets the media type of the resource. Accepts only 'application/json'.

parameters.name: filter_by_name
parameters.description: Filters services by specifying a name query to match.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of service records to retrieve per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination in search results, allowing for navigation through pages.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: team_ids
parameters.description: An array of team IDs. Only services related to these teams will be returned. Requires the `teams` ability.

value_schema.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: Specify the time zone for rendering results. Defaults to the account time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: sort_services_by
parameters.description: Specify the field to sort the results by. Options: 'name', 'name:asc', 'name:desc'.

value_schema.description: Used to specify the field you wish to sort the results on.

parameters.name: include_additional_details
parameters.description: Specify additional details to include, such as escalation policies or teams. Options are: escalation_policies, teams, integrations, auto_pause_notifications_parameters.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: filter_by_service_name
parameters.description: Filters results to show only services with the specified name.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only services with the specified name.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the `total` field in pagination responses, enabling a complete total count.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: team_ids[]
parameters.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

value_schema.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Used to specify the field you wish to sort the results on.

value_schema.description: Used to specify the field you wish to sort the results on.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional details to include.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only services with the specified name.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only services with the specified name.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
